articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of China's Country Garden (2007.HK) plunged more than 12% on Monday morning after the real estate company suspended trading in 11 of its onshore bonds from Monday.
articles.title: Country Garden shares slump to record low after onshore bond trading halted

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) has cut prices in China for its Model Y long-range and performance versions starting on Aug. 14, the company said in a notice on Monday.
articles.title: Tesla cuts prices in China for some Model Y versions

articles.author: Echo Wang, Anirban Sen
articles.description: SoftBank Group Corp (9984.T) is in talks to acquire the 25% stake in Arm Ltd it does not directly own from Vision Fund 1 (VF1), a $100 billion investment fund it raised in 2017, according to people familiar with the matter, potentially delivering a win for investors who have waited years for strong returns.
articles.title: Exclusive: SoftBank in talks to buy Vision Fund's 25% stake in Arm -sources

articles.author: Navya Mittal
articles.description: Australia's Federal Court on Monday ordered Dell Technologies Inc's (DELL.N) local unit to pay A$10 million ($6.46 million) in penalties for making misleading representations on its website about discounts for add-on computer monitors.
articles.title: Australian court fines Dell unit $6.5 mln for misleading customers on discounts

articles.author: Ankur Banerjee
articles.description: The yen was volatile on Monday after slipping to its lowest for the year against the dollar, breaching the key 145 level as traders warily looked for clues on possible intervention, while the dollar rose to touch a more than one month high.
articles.title: Yen breaks above 145/dlr level in choppy trading, dollar firm

articles.author: Daniel Leussink
articles.description: Japanese automakers are getting much-needed cover from an old standby, as the weaker yen helps prop up profits amid declining sales in China and the increasingly tough shift to electric vehicles.
articles.title: Weak yen gives Japan's automakers temporary relief from China pain

articles.author: Selena Li
articles.description: U.S. bank Citigroup (C.N) has completed the sale and migration of its Taiwan consumer businesses to Singapore's DBS Group (DBSM.SI), it said on Monday.
articles.title: US bank Citi completes sale of Taiwan consumer unit to Singapore's DBS

articles.author: Nicolás Misculin, Eliana Raszewski, Candelaria Grimberg
articles.description: Argentine voters punished the country's two main political forces in a primary election on Sunday, pushing a rock-singing libertarian outsider candidate into first place in a huge shake-up in the race towards presidential elections in October.
articles.title: Argentine far-right outsider Javier Milei takes shock lead in primary vote

articles.author: Jorge Garcia, Mike Blake
articles.description: The death toll from the Maui wildfires reached 93 on Sunday as relatives of the missing frantically searched for signs their loved ones may still be alive.
articles.title: Maui wildfires death toll hits 93 amid frantic search for the missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia is in the process of equipping its new nuclear submarines with hypersonic Zircon missiles, the head of Russia's largest shipbuilder told the RIA state news agency in an interview published on Monday.
articles.title: Russia to equip new nuclear submarines with hypersonic missiles
